newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar called to open mostly unchanged.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar called to open mostly unchanged.

text.p: CSCE world sugar was called to open little changed Tuesday, dealers said.
Market sources said Sugar Week in New York, next week's Memorial Day and a dearth of fundamental news will keep players sidelined for this week.
Monday, benchmark July closed off 0.01 cent at 10.96 cents per lb after trading from 11.01 to 10.94 cents. The outer contracts settled 0.01 higher to 0.03 lower.
Firm technical support remained at 10.92 and then at 10.85 cents, while traders pegged upside targets at 11.11 followed by 11.20 cents, for July sugar.
LIFFE white sugar futures were up barely today amid slim volume. Spot August stood $0.10 firmer at $318.50, and the outer months unchanged to $0.50 lower, at 0840 EDT/1340 GMT.
